CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action before the Pest Central District Court seeking the termination of the common ownership of real estate belonging to him and his divorced wife .

CARDINAL . At the subsequent hearings on DATE , DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the applicant extended his claims to include the allocation of other items of the matrimonial property . He was repeatedly invited to give better particulars of his claims .

CARDINAL . On the applicant ’s procedural appeal , on DATE ORG ordered that the proceedings be resumed . Subsequently , hearings were held on CARDINAL September CARDINAL , DATE and DATE . On DATE ORG appointed a valuation expert . The expert filed his report on DATE .

CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG issued a payment order against the applicant concerning unpaid social - security contributions . Subsequently the applicant brought an action in LOC challenging the lawfulness of the administrative decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court observed that , due to a change of legislation , the respondent was replaced by ORG . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s procedural appeal . He filed a petition for review with ORG which he withdrew on DATE .
